page.title: 17Badabrie/Banavie: Housing
page.content: {Houses Old and New} The fastest growing area of house construction at the present is at Badabrie, a small section of hillside west of the Caledonian Canal where an increasing amount of private housing is being built. Finally the oldest houses on this block are to be found along the canal side and in Banavie village here there is a mixture of private and council properties and a mixture of the old and the new. Here in Banavie can be found older traces of the areas history, the most notable example being the Canal Lock-keepers' houses, built by the great engineer Thomas Telford, with their bow frontages which enabled the keeper to view the traffic passing up and down the canal.
